meanings.definition: The ability of a substance to refract light.
meanings.sent1: The refractivity of the glass prism caused the light to bend.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the refractivity of different materials to understand how they interact with light.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten was fascinated by the refractivity of the shiny crystal.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness had a refractivity that brightened everyone's day.
meanings.sent5: The refractivity of the diamond created a dazzling display of colors.

meanings.definition: The measure of how much a substance refracts light.
meanings.sent1: The refractivity of the water was higher than that of air.
meanings.sent2: The refractivity of the lens determined the quality of the camera's focus.
meanings.sent3: The chef carefully measured the refractivity of the sugar for the perfect caramelization.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm had a refractivity that drew people towards him.
meanings.sent5: The refractivity of the atmosphere made the sunset look even more beautiful.
